Subject: Cantera on Mac OS X 10.4.10
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=312916024; y=NmysbGGbqmV7hHdrc_yJp4S_HczkROJIVpEECHjnqiINjLE

Hello,

I am attempting to install Cantera onto a mac operating Mac OS X
10=
.4.10 and I would like to interface Cantera with Matlab 2007a. I
believe I =
am having trouble with the connection between Cantera and
Matlab as a resul=
t of incorrect definition of environmental variables.

The following may be=
 relevant: I've compiled and executed python 2.5.1
using Terminal Version 1=
.5  (Mac program found in Utilities; as
opposed to xcode). Additionally I'v=
e downloaded the CVS version of
cantera using instructions from
http://blue=
.caltech.edu/~dgg/html/cantera-build.html and executed the
preconfig file w=
ith minimum modifications. I've executed mex -setup
within the Matlab comma=
nd window and changed Matlab's compiler to a
gcc version.

After running pr=
econfig, a portion of the following code is produced:
(Config SUMMARY OF IN=
CLUDED/EXCLUDED CAPABILIIES:)
...
checking for python2... no
checking for p=
ython...
/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/Current/bin/python
P=
ython command set by configure to 
/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Ver=
sions/Current/bin/python
Matlab command preset to /Applications/Matlab/bin/=

checking MATLAB (/Applications/Matlab/bin/)... failed!
checking for Positi=
on independent code command ...  -fPIC
checking for a BSD-compatible instal=
l... /usr/bin/install -c
INSTALL program has been set to  /usr/bin/install =
-c
checking whether we are using the GNU C++ compiler... (cached) yes
check=
ing whether g++ accepts -g... (cached) yes
...

I believe that when I am at=
tempting to build the matlab toolbox I have
incorrectly defined the variabl=
e "Matlab_CMD"; as a result it fails to
locate Matlab on my computer. I am =
not sure what the value of
Matlab_CMD should be (see code from preconfig fi=
le below). Could
someone explain what environmental variables are within th=
e context of
Cantera? Also, any are there any obvious things I am doing inc=
orrectly?

Eli Goldstein 

#----------- MATLAB ----------------------------=
----------------------

# This variable controls whether the MATLAB toolbox=
 will be built. It
# should be set to one of these strings:
#
#      "defau=
lt"     the 'configure' script will try to build a simple 
#               =
     MATLAB MEX file. If this succeeds,
BUILD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX
#             =
       will be set to "y", otherwise it will be set to "n".
#              =
      
#      "y"           build the MATLAB toolbox.
#      "n"           =
do not build the MATLAB toolbox, even if MATLAB is 
#                    in=
stalled.
#
# Note that you may need to run 'mex -setup' within MATLAB to
# =
configure it for your C++ compiler before running this script.
BUILD_MATLAB=
_TOOLBOX=3D${BUILD_MATLAB_TOOLBOX:=3D"y"}
MATLAB_CMD=3D${MATLAB_CMD:=3D"/Ap=
plications/Matlab/bin/"}
